fix setuptools deprecations (#93)

fix setuptools deprecations.
Remove old definition.
New definition is already defined in row ~27 :license= 'BSD'

data.author: Silvio Traversaro
data.message: Fix name of BSD PyPI classifier (#88)

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix UTF8 reading. (#83)

Do this by opening files in binary mode, which will allow
the XML parser to convert to UTF-8 if it is specified.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Switch to unittest.mock (#78)

The mock package has been integrated into unittest since Python 3.3,
which includes all supported distributions of ROS 2.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Shane Loretz
data.message:
1.2.0

Signed-off-by: Shane Loretz <sloretz@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix the binary install location. (#74)

The previous one was wrong.  With this fix in place,
'ros2 run urdfdom_py display_urdf' now works.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Get Iterable from collections.abc. (#73)

* Get Iterable from collections.abc.

Getting Iterable from collections was deprecated in Python 3.9
and removed in 3.10.

* Use underscores for setup.cfg keys.

Using dashes is deprecated.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Use a Python entry point for 'display_urdf' (#64)

This will make the script work on Windows, and will ensure that the
correct Python interpreter is always used.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Move the 'display_urdf' script into the Python module (#64)

The change following this one will modify the script to use a Python
entry point.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Make 'file' argument to display_urdf required (#64)

The underlying operation, fetching the URDF from the parameter server,
is no longer supported in ROS 2.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make sure to add the version when creating a new URDF. (#62)

It turns out that when I added the version stuff, I completely
forgot about creating a new URDF.  This PR fixes it so that
we can successfully round-trip through the URDF parser, and
adds tests to ensure the same.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the from_parameter_server method from urdf.py for ROS 2. (#63)

This can't possibly work on ROS 2, so just remove it.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Silence pytest warnings when running locally. (#61)

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Silvio Traversaro
data.message:
urdf_parser_py.xml_reflection : python 3 compatibility 

Substitute 'Exception, e' with `Exception as e`. This ensure compatibility with Python 3 and Python 2.6,2.7 . 
Check https://docs.python.org/3/howto/pyporting.html#capturing-the-currently-raised-exception for more info.

data.author: Eric Cousineau
data.message: There's a problem if an element is supposed to be unique and there's multiple instances of it, it will be overwritten by later occurences. In what seems to be the policy of the urdfdom parser, it uses the first instance, whereas this implementation uses the last instance.

data.author: Antonio El Khoury
data.message:
Fix inertia matrix constructor.

  * ixy was set to iyy by mistake.
  * Reported by Joseph Salini.

data.author: Antonio El Khoury
data.message:
Do not strip trailing zeros in float display.

 * Stripping trailing zeros causes the removal of exponents if value
   is expressed in scientific notation (e.g. 1.2e-10 -> 1.2e-1).

data.author: Antonio El Khoury
data.message:
Fix float display while writing xml document.

 * The older method caused a loss of float precision when writing urdf
   file.

data.author: Kelsey Hawkins
data.message:
Added verbose flag to parsing methods.  If false, the parser will not throw warnings if
it encounters unknown elements.

data.author: Kelsey Hawkins
data.message: Changed Joint names to strings (was causing a bug), added get_root which detects the link which is top in the tree (URDF's should guarantee a unique root/tree structure), and added an option to get_chain which allows one to not include fixed joints in the chain.
